resources.string: "Please, put more attention to sensitivity adjusting to avoid false operations. Unfortunately there is an Android OS issue on some phones (usually Motorola and some HTC devices) that apps cannot receive accelerometer events while screen is off or locked. I can do nothing to workaround this (it has been fixed in Android 2.2). But let's hope for the best =) Work of this app may seem freezy, but that's because of indirect mechanisms of remote player controlling"
Please, describe the problem in details. More details - more help in the bugfix =) Use SendLog for the best bugreports

"Times the app played next song by shake: %s1. If you think it is useful, please, click the ad below %s2 more times and any ad will disappear (this window won't popup again, too). Thanks for your support!"
"First start music player, then start this app and it's service Please, read Important info from the menu once, to know some important notes"
"Put the phone in your pocket or another usual place and shake it or press BACK to finish testing. You'll hear notification sound, when shake event occurs"

"This option is for phones, which cannot connect to accelerometer while screen is off (and that is why Shake2PlayNext doesn't work on these phones). This option will keep your screen on while Shake2PlayNext's service is running. IT REQUIRES MUCH POWER FROM YOUR BATTERY"
Scroll this screen down to see all available options

"It is a generic way to support players, which can receive MEDIA_BUTTON intent and which can not be controlled in a good (see list above =) way. This should work quite well with Froyo. Older OS versions may launch several players simultaneously (even with >15 sec delay), so you may have to uninstall unused players. If it starts Android Music app, than this option is not for you, I think. Generally this option will start playing even if player is paused. This behavior is not always suitable, but better, than nothing.
Tested with: TuneWiki, Vanilla Music and bTunes.
To control bTunes try to check ONLY KEY-UP CHECKBOX. For TuneWiki and Vanilla try to check both checkboxes or only key-down one. For other players you should investigate which checkboxes to check"
